intro: Staehelina kurdica, commonly known as Kurdish starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, typically in clusters. Staehelina kurdica is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and botanical research.
